Withey, Voyages of Discovery: Captain Cook and the Exploration of the Pacific
John Dunmore, French Explorers in the Pacific

‘Seapower and Science: The Motives for Pacific Exploration,’
Background to Discovery: Pacific Exploration from Dampier to Cook

The Pacific Journal of Louis-Antoine de Bougainville, 1767–1768

title: ‘Charles de Brosses, the Man behind Cook,’’ in The Opening of the Pacific: Image and Reality
‘Captain Cook and the South Seas,’
The Lusiads of Luis de Cam~ oes
The English translation of the great epic poem composed in the sixteenth century to celebrate Portuguese achievements in Asia from Prince Henry to Afonso de Albuquerque
Europeans in West Africa, 1450–1560
An excellent collection of primary documents from Portuguese, Castilian, and English sources

note: Spanish Voyages d’Anghiera, Pietro Martire. The Decades of the newe worlde or west India.
title: The Three Voyages of Vasco da Gama, and His Viceroyalty
Da Gama’s three voyages to India, as recorded by a contemporary chronicler attached to the Portuguese court

container-title: De orbe novo: The Eight Decades of Peter Martyr d’Anghera
The Voyages of Pedro Fernandez de Quiros
Menda~ na, Alvaro de]. The Discovery of the Solomon Islands. Translated and edited by Lord Amherst of Hackney and Basil Thomson

The account of the Spanish discovery of the Solomon chain by the early Spanish explorer in the Pacific. Mozino, Jose Mariano. Noticias de Nutka: An Account of Nootka Sound in 1792. Translated and edited by Iris H. Wilson
title: A facsimile edition of the first English translation of the initial three Decades of Anghiera’s chronicle of Spain’s discoveries in and conquest of the New World
Three early accounts of the New World, written by
Six Documents of His Expedition in 1774
A collection of reports, letters, and accounts of Spanish exploration in the Pacific northwest in the late eighteenth century
Journal of Tom as de Surıa of His Voyage with Malaspina to the North-West Coast of America in 1791
An account of Malaspina’s voyage by an artist-engraver attached to the expedition
The Diario of Christopher Columbus’s First Voyage to America, 1492–1493. Abstracted by Fray Bartolome de las Casas
Of the various translations of Columbus’s first voyage to and discovery of the New World, this is the best, and provides the text both in English and in Spanish
A modern translation of Pietro Martire d’Anghiera’s chronicle of Spain’s discovery and conquest of the New World
The account of the voyages of the sixteenth-century Spanish explorer into the Pacific
This description of Nootka Sound on Vancouver Island was written by the official botanist attached to the expedition of Bodega y Quadra to the Pacific northwest

translator.given: The First Three English Books on America

container-title: New Light on the Discovery of Australia
publisher: Times Books and Hector and Rose
title: New Iberian World: A Documentary History of the Discovery and Settlement of Latin America to the Early Seventeenth Century
A valuable collection of primary documents in English translation, many previously unpublished, that relate to Spanish exploration and conquest of the Americas
A chronicle of the Pacific voyage and discoveries of Quiros by his subordinate. Vazquez de Espinoza. Compendium and Description of the West Indies
An early chronicle of Spanish explorations and conquests in the Caribbean, written by a contemporary
The Libro de las profecıas of Christopher Columbus
This recent translation of Columbus’s Book of Prophecies provides insight into the explorer’s religious beliefs and outlook on the world in his own words
Henry Hudson, the Navigator
An account of the voyages in search of a Northeast and Northwest Passage by the discoverer of Hudson Bay
The Three Voyages of Martin Frobisher
Accounts of Frobisher’s three voyages to the Arctic in search of a Northwest Passage
A New Voyage Round the World
Dampier’s account of his first circumnavigation of the world as a privateer/buccaneer
The World Encompassed
A facsimile version of the original sixteenth-century publication of Drake’s voyage around the world
The Journals of Captain Cook
An inexpensive and unabridged edition of all three voyages of the great explorer in his own words
Byron’s Journal of His Circumnavigation, 1764–1766
The account of the first of the late eighteenth-century Pacific voyages

container-title: The Last Voyage of Thomas Cavendish, 1591–92
The Discovery of Tahiti: A Journal of the Second Voyage of H.M.S
title: Voyages and Discoveries: The Principal Navigations, Voyages, Traffiques and Discoveries of the English Nation
An abridged version of the 1598 edition of Hakluyt’s compilation of early English voyages through the sixteenth century
The Voyages and Works of John Davis, the Navigator
An early edition of the account of Davis’s search in the sixteenth century for a Northwest Passage
The Voyages of William Baffin
An original account of Baffin’s exploration in search of a Northwest Passage
A description of the failed second voyage of the Elizabethan adventurer to the Pacific
A chronicle of the voyage of Samuel Wallis to the Pacific in 1766–1768
Philip Carteret’s Voyage Round the World, 1766–1769
A description of the second major British expedition to the Pacific in the late eighteenth century
Abel Janszoon Tasman’s Journals of His Discovery of Van Diemen’s Land and New Zealand in 1642
An account of Tasman’s first voyage to Australia under Van Diemen
The East and West Indian Mirror
The account of the Pacific voyage of Le Maire and Schouten in the early seventeenth century
The Voyages of Abel Janszoon Tasman
A description of Tasman’s voyages of exploration to Australia, New Zealand, and adjacent islands

container-title: Russian Penetration of the North Pacific Ocean, 1700–1797
An invaluable collection of documents in English translation from the eighteenth century related to Russian exploration of Siberia and the north Pacific
title: The Three Voyages of William Barents to the Arctic Regions
An account of the Dutch explorer’s search for a Northeast Passage to China
Bering’s Voyages: The Reports from Russia

A modern English translation of the official reports by which tsarist Russia learned of Bering’s accomplishments, written by a member of the Russian Academy of Sciences who accompanied his second expedition in 1733–1740
Journal of a Voyage with Bering, 1741–1742
Bering’s final expedition to the northwest coast of North America as written by a German naturalist who accompanied the voyage
An excellent and comprehensive source of articles on all matters pertaining to Columbus, his four voyages, and the world in which he lived
The Captain Cook Encyclopedia
An excellent reference work with articles not only on Cook and his various voyages but also on subjects ranging from geography to technological and scientific terms
Who Was Who in World Exploration
A very useful reference work with well-written articles on explorers, from earliest times into the twentieth century. Surveys and General Histories of the European Age of Discovery Albion
Exploration and Discovery
A collection of essays that examines aspects of exploration and discovery, from the late Middle Ages to the early twentieth century
Consumption and the World of Goods
A collection of essays that examines the growth of transglobal commercial interaction that developed after European navigators had opened the world’s sea routes
Trade and Civilization in the Indian Ocean: An Economic History from the Rise of Islam to 1750
An overview of cultural and economic patterns in Asia prior to European expansion into the Indian Ocean and their impact
Technological Innovation & European Expansion, 1400–1700
This excellent short study explores the technological development of guns and sailing ships as the foundation for European expansion during the Age of Discovery
The Columbian Exchange: Biological and Cultural Consequences of 1492
An argument about the medical and epidemiological consequences in the Americas that followed in the wake of Columbus’s discovery of the New World
The Old World and the New, 1492–1650

This classic work examines the intellectual consequences of the discovery and settlement of the Americas for early modern Europe, analyzing the ways that contact with new lands challenged traditional assumptions about geography, theology, history, and the nature of man. Fernandez-Armesto, Felipe. Before Columbus: Exploration and Colonization from the Mediterranean to the Atlantic, 1229–1492
A comprehensive survey of medieval exploration that is difficult to read, but rewarding
New Worlds, Ancient Texts: The Power of Tradition and the Shock of Discovery

This volume demonstrates how the evidence that a previously unknown New World existed shook the foundations of the old, upsetting the authority of ancient texts that had guided Europeans through the Middle Ages and Renaissance
A survey of the Annotated Bibliography 177 development of maritime navigation from earliest times to the present, written by a specialist in layman’s terms

publisher: Burt Franklin and Lenox Hill, Publishers
title: The Great Age of Discovery

A collection of essays that examine a range of subjects related to the Age of Discovery from changing European perceptions of the world in the late Middle Ages to the voyages of discovery and the foundation of colonial empires
The Age of Reconnaissance: Discovery, Exploration and Settlement, 1450 to 1650
A classic overview of European exploration during the Age of Discovery by a leading specialist
The Establishment of the European Hegemony, 1415–1715
This short volume explores the foundations of European dominance of maritime trade and empire through various aspects of exploration, in particular the Portuguese and Spanish discoveries
Travel and Discovery in the Renaissance, 1420–1602
A very good overview of European exploration up to the mid-seventeenth century
The Medieval Expansion of Europe
The best overview of European interest in, and knowledge of, the world beyond Christendom; it is especially good on European travelers overland to the East in the thirteenth century
The First Imperial Age: European Overseas Expansion, c. 1400–1715

The book is organized around a set of broad themes, for example, European motives for exploration and expansion; how they managed to establish themselves in some parts of the world but not in others; the ways in which they exploited their new possessions, the nature of colonial societies; and the impact of the imperial experience on contemporary Europe
Despite their importance to the Age of Discovery, few maritime explorers have found their biographers, and most of what exists is old. The following titles are, however, a place to start
Renaissance Crusader
A brief but very good biography of the Portuguese explorer, which places his life and voyages in the historical context

container-title: 1894. An old but still useful biography of the Portuguese explorer. Irving, Washington. The Life and Voyages of Christopher Columbus
title: His Life and Times
One of the few biographies of the English explorer
The Life of Captain James Cook
This is still the best and most detailed biography of the explorer and his voyages to the Pacific
Although old, this is still a solid study of the Cabots’ contribution to exploration and one of the few books on the subject
Magellan and the First Circumnavigation of the World
A popular biography, well illustrated, of the Portuguese explorer
Francis Drake: The Lives of a Hero
A survey of the Elizabethan mariner’s life and accomplishments
A Savage Quest in the Americas
A revisionist biography of the Spanish explorer that deglorifies him and seeks to describe in unvarnished terms De Soto’s expeditions in Peru and Florida
The Life of Ferdinand Magellan and the First Circumnavigation of the Globe
The first biography of Columbus, in any language, by the famous American storyteller; more interesting for the anecdotes Washington fabricated about the explorer’s life than as a reliable history
Captain Cook
A nicely illustrated, popular biography of the great Pacific explorer
A Life of John Davis, the Navigator, Discoverer of Davis Straits
One of the few biographies of the Elizabethan explorer
The Great Adventurer and the Fate of Aztec Mexico
A biography of the great conquistador that focuses on his subjugation of Mexico
The Life of Sir Martin Frobisher
A solid biography of the explorer and Elizabethan adventurer
Admiral of the Ocean Sea: A Life of Christopher Columbus
Still the classic biography of Columbus, well written and time-tested
The Worlds of Christopher Columbus
This book examines the life and accomplishments of Columbus in the broad context of European and world history
One of the few biographies of the Italian explorer after whom the Americas are named
Henry Hudson
A standard biography of the English explorer
Balboa of Darien: Discoverer of the Pacific
Although dated, this is a reliable portrait of Balboa and one of the few English-language biographies of the Spanish explorer
Prince Henry ‘‘the Navigator’’: A Life
An excellent and detailed biography of the father of European exploration
Longitude: The True Story of a Lone Genius Who Solved the Greatest Scientific Problem of His Time
A popular biography of clockmaker John Harrison, his search for a solution to the navigational problem of longitude, and his development of the chronometer
Sir Francis Drake
A comprehensive study of the Elizabethan adventurer, intended for a popular audience
William Dampier
A standard, if dated, biography of the privateer-turned-explorer
Four Centuries of Portuguese Expansion, 1415–1825
A comprehensive survey by the leading authority
The Portuguese Seaborne Empire, 1415–1825
The classic history of Portugal’s maritime empire, required reading for anyone interested in the Portuguese achievement or the Age of Discovery
Foundations of the Portuguese Empire, 1415–1580

A chronological survey of the Portuguese discoveries, with discussion of problematic historical issues and myths, and an emphasis on the political and military aspect of Portugal’s maritime empire in Asia
Portugal in Africa
An authoritative and detailed study of Portuguese contact with Africa from the fifteenth through the twentieth centuries

container-title: Subrahmanyam, Sanjay. The Portuguese Empire in Asia, 1500–1700: A Political and Economic History
title: Shipwreck and Empire: Portuguese Maritime Disasters in a Century of Decline
The volume examines the problem of shipwreck as background to the decline of the Portuguese empire in Asia between 1550 and 1650
The Portuguese in India
A brief, well-written and up-to-date discussion of Portugal’s early maritime empire in India
The Portuguese Empire, 1415–1808: A World on the Move
A good survey history of the birth, growth, and eventual decline of the Portuguese maritime empire over four centuries and four continents
This book explores the Asian and East African dimension of the Portuguese maritime empire, how it came into being, and how it changed over time
Spain in America
A splendidly clear and balanced narrative
Spain and Portugal in the New World, 1492–1700
The most up-to-date history of the great South American empires of Spain and Portugal
The Spanish Seaborne Empire
The standard historical survey of Spain’s maritime empire in the Caribbean, the Americas, and the Philippines by one of the founders of the field
‘The Spanish Lake.’
This brief article by the historian of the Manila galleons explains how it is that Spain laid claim to, and endeavored to maintain, its legal claim over the Pacific Ocean
To the Arctic! The Story of Northern Exploration from Earliest Times
A lively and interesting narrative of Arctic exploration from the ancient Greeks to the mid-1940s, including the search for a Northwest and a Northeast Passage
In Quest of the Northwest Passage
A brief, popular history of the search for the Northwest Passage from Frobisher to Sir
The Search for the Northwest Passage
This book traces the search for the passage to China from the Elizabethan voyages of the sixteenth century to the first successful journey through the passage in the early twentieth century
The Exploration of the Pacific
A classic history of Pacific exploration from Magellan to James Cook by the leading authority
The Dutch Seaborne Empire, 1600–1800
An excellent introduction to the subject
Explorers of the Pacific: European and American Discoveries in Polynesia
A relatively brief but solid survey history of Spanish, English, Dutch, French, and Russian voyages into the Pacific
French Explorers in the Pacific
This book focuses on French voyages to the Pacific from the sixteenth through the eighteenth centuries
Background to Discovery: Pacific Exploration from Dampier to Cook
A collection of essays that examine different aspects of the eighteenth-century Pacific voyages of Great Britain and France
Dutch Primacy in World Trade, 1585–1740
A general survey of the development of Dutch trade in the Atlantic and in Asia
Pacific Passions: The European Struggle for Power in the Great Ocean in the Age of Exploration
A sweeping narrative of 250 years of European exploration of the Pacific, from Balboa to the voyages of Cook

note: from the circumnavigation of Francis Drake to that of Commodore George Anson.
title: The Great South Sea: English Voyages and Encounters, 1570–1750
A very readable history of English voyages to the Pacific prior to the expeditions of James Cook
Voyages of Discovery: Captain Cook and the Exploration of the Pacific

This account focuses on James Cook’s three voyages to the Pacific and his skills as a navigator and leader of men, while fixing his expeditions in the scientific, strategic and literary settings of the day
This is the Web site for Hakluyt Society of London, with links to its history, publications, and so on

LOVE is Associate Professor of History at the University of West Georgia, Carrollton, GA. He is co-editor of Distant Lands and Diverse Cultures: The French Experience in Asia, 1600–1700 (Praeger, 2002) and is currently completing a book-length study of Franco-Thai relations from 1660 to 1690
